text: Hello, my name is Sam. I am learning
English today. I want to tell you about
my day at the market. This is a simple
story. You can read it and learn with
me. It is a sunny day. I go to the
market. The market is busy. There are
many people. I see vegetables, fruits,
and flowers. I like the smell of fresh
fruit. I want to buy some apples. I walk
to a fruit stand. There is a lady at the
stand. She is very nice. I say, "Hello,
how much are the apples?"
She smiles and says, " $1 per apple." I
take three apples. I give her $3. She
gives me the apples and some change. I
see a man selling flowers. He has
beautiful roses. I ask him, "How much
are the roses?" He says, " $2 for one
rose."
I buy one rose. I like roses very much.
I walk around the market. I see many
people buying food and drinks. Some
people are talking to each other. I
listen and try to understand the words.
I don't understand everything, but I try
my best. I feel happy. I am learning
English. It is good to practice every
day. I want to visit the market again.
This is my day at the market. I practice
speaking English and I learn new words.
I hope you enjoyed my story. You can
learn English, too. Chapter 2. It is a
beautiful morning. I wake up early. I
look outside. The sun is shining. I am
excited. Today is a special day. I am
going to meet my friend John. John is
from Canada. He is also learning
English. We both study together. I eat
breakfast. I have eggs, bread, and
juice. I like eggs very much. After
breakfast, I put on my shoes. I take my
bag. I am ready to go. I leave my house
and walk to the bus stop. I wait for the
bus. The bus comes. I get on the bus. It
is not very full.
There are a few people. I sit by the
window. I like sitting by the window. I
can see the street and the trees. The
bus goes through the city. I see many
shops. I see a big park. I see people
walking and running. The bus stops at my
stop. I get off the bus and walk to the
cafe where I will meet John. I arrive at
the cafe.
John is already there. He is sitting at
a table. He is drinking coffee. I go to
him. He smiles and says, "Hello, Sam." I
sit down. We shake hands. We are happy
to see each other. We start talking.
John tells me about his life in Canada.
He says, "I am from a small town. It is
very quiet there. I miss my family, but
I like studying English in London." I
tell him about my life. I say, "I am
from a big city. It is very busy here. I
like living in London. I want to speak
English very well.
We talk about our studies. We both want
to speak English fluently.
John says, "I think the best way to
learn English is to practice every day."
I agree with him. Yes. I say we need to
use English in our daily life.
We talk for a long time.
Then we decide to go to the park.
We walk to the park together. The
weather is very nice. The park is big
and green. There are many people in the
park. Some people are walking their
dogs. Some people are sitting on
benches. Some people are playing sports.
We find a bench to sit on. We sit and
talk more. We speak in English. It is
not always easy, but we try our best.
Sometimes we stop and look for new
words. John says, "I don't know how to
say this word in English." I help him
and he helps me too. It is fun learning
together.
After some time, we decide to go for a
walk in the park. We see many beautiful
flowers. I like the flowers. They are
colorful.
John takes a picture of a rose. He shows
it to me. This is a nice rose, he says.
I agree.
Yes, it is beautiful.
We continue walking. We see a fountain
in the park. The water is sparkling in
the sunlight. There are many birds
around the fountain. The birds are
singing. It is a peaceful place. I feel
happy.
We sit on the grass and take a rest. We
talk about our future plans.
John says, "I want to go to a university
in London. I want to study business.
I think about my plans.
I want to work in a big company. I also
want to travel to other countries."
We talk about many things like our
families, our hobbies, and our dreams.
It is time to go.
We say goodbye.
John goes back to his apartment. I go
back to my house. I feel good. I
practiced speaking English. I met my
friend. I learned new words. It was a
good day.
When I get home, I think about my lesson
for the day. I remember the words we
used. I decide to write them down.
Writing new words helps me remember
them. I feel proud of myself.
I also watch a movie in English. I try
to listen carefully to the words.
It is not easy, but I understand some
parts. I repeat the words I hear. I
practice my pronunciation.
I am happy because I am improving.
I look at my clock. It is late. I am
tired but satisfied.
Today was a good day for learning
English. I look forward to tomorrow.
I will practice more and learn more. I
know that every day is important.
Every day I get better at speaking
English.
Tomorrow I will meet John again. We will
study together. We will speak in English
and learn from each other. I am excited
for the next lesson. I am excited to
improve more. Learning English is a
journey and I am happy to be on this
journey.
Chapter 3. It is another sunny day. I
wake up early again. I feel happy
because today I will meet my friend
John. We have decided to visit a museum
together. I like museums. They are quiet
and I can learn a lot of new things. I
eat a quick breakfast. I have cereal and
milk. I like cereal because it is easy
to make.
After breakfast, I get dressed.
I wear my favorite shirt and jeans. Then
I take my bag and leave the house. I
walk to the bus stop. The bus comes
quickly. I get on the bus. There are a
few people. Some people are reading
newspapers. Others are listening to
music. I sit down by the window. I can
see the city as the bus moves. It is a
busy city, but today it is a little
quieter than usual.
The bus stops at my stop. I get off and
walk to the museum. It is only a few
minutes away. When I arrive, I see John
waiting for me. He smiles and says, "Hi,
Sam."
I smile back.
"Hello, John." I say.
We go inside the museum. It is a big
building. There are many rooms with
different exhibits. We start with the
art room. There are many paintings on
the walls. Some paintings are old and
some are new. I like the paintings with
bright colors.
John says, "This one is beautiful." He
points to a painting of a sunset. The
colors are red, orange, and yellow. I
agree with him.
Yes, it is lovely, I say. We walk to the
next room. It has many old sculptures.
Some sculptures are of people. Some are
of animals. I like the sculptures
because they look very real.
John asks me, "Do you like this one?" He
points to a sculpture of a man.
Yes, it looks very lifelike. I say it's
amazing how the artist made it look so
real.
We spend a lot of time in the museum
looking at different exhibits. We read
the signs next to each exhibit to learn
more about them. John asks me some
questions.
What do you think about this painting?
he asks.
What is your favorite exhibit? I answer.
I like the art room the most. I love the
colors and the shapes and the paintings.
John smiles.
I like the sculptures, he says.
They are so interesting.
After a while, we feel hungry.
We decide to go to the cafe inside the
museum.
We sit down at a table. John orders a
sandwich and I order a salad.
We talk while we eat. John tells me
about his family. He says, "I have two
sisters. One is older and one is
younger. We are a close family." I tell
him about my family. I have one brother.
He is younger than me. He is in school
and I am studying English, I say. We
finish our lunch and decide to look at
one more room. This room has old things
from different countries. There are
masks from Africa, pottery from China,
and clothes from India. John and I talk
about the things we see.
These masks are so interesting, I say.
They look different from anything I have
seen before.
John agrees.
Yes, they are beautiful, he says.
We spend another hour walking through
the museum, looking at all the
interesting things.
Finally, we decide it is time to go. We
leave the museum and walk outside. The
sun is still shining, but it is a little
cooler now.
We walk to the bus stop together. We
talk about what we saw in the museum. We
both agree that it was a great day. When
the bus comes, we get on. We sit next to
each other. It is a quiet ride home. I
feel happy because I learned new things
today. I also feel happy because I
practiced my English. I spoke with John
a lot and I learned some new words. It
was a good day. When I get home, I think
about what I saw in the museum. I
remember the paintings and the
sculptures.
I decide to write about my day in my
notebook.
Writing helps me remember the words I
learned. It also helps me practice my
writing. I write down the names of some
things I saw in the museum.
Sunset painting, sculpture of a man,
African mask, and Chinese pottery.
I feel proud because I know these words.
After I finish writing, I watch a short
video in English. I try to understand
everything. It is not easy, but I can
understand some parts.
I write down new words I don't know. I
look up their meanings in the
dictionary.
Before bed, I feel satisfied.
I learned many things today. I practiced
speaking, reading, and writing.
Tomorrow I will study more. I want to
learn English as quickly as I can. I
want to speak English like a native
speaker. It will take time, but I know I
can do it. Every day I will get better.
I go to bed feeling happy. Today was a
good day for learning English. Tomorrow
will be even better.
Chapter 4. It is another busy day. I
wake up early again. I feel good because
today is a special day.
I am going to visit a friend I met in
class. Her name is Maria. She is from
Spain. We both study English together.
And today she invited me to her home. I
have breakfast. I eat toast with butter
and drink a cup of tea. I like tea in
the morning. After breakfast, I get
ready. I wear my comfortable shoes and
take my bag. I am ready to go.
I leave my house and walk to the bus
stop. The bus comes quickly. I get on
the bus and sit by the window. I like
sitting here because I can see the city.
The streets are full of people. Some
people are walking fast and others are
slow. Some people are talking on their
phones and some are listening to music.
The bus ride is not long.
I arrive at Maria's house in about 15
minutes. Her house is in a quiet
neighborhood. There are many trees
around. I knock on the door and Maria
opens it. She smiles and says, "Hi, Sam.
Come in." I smile back. Hello, Maria.
Thank you for inviting me. I say.
Maria shows me around her house. It is
very nice. The living room is big and
bright. There are some chairs and a
small table. There are pictures on the
walls. I see a picture of Maria's
family. I ask her, "Is this your
family?" She nods and says, "Yes, this
is my mother, father, and brother."
I look at the picture. They all look
happy. Maria takes me to the kitchen.
She says, "I will make some coffee for
us." I say, "Thank you." I like coffee.
Maria makes the coffee. We sit at the
kitchen table and start talking. We talk
about our studies. Maria tells me, "I
want to speak English better. I want to
find a job here in London." I say, "Me,
too. I want to speak better English and
find a good job.
We talk for a while. It is nice to speak
with Maria because she is very friendly
and kind.
After we finish our coffee, Maria asks,
"Do you want to go to the park with me?"
I say, "Yes, I would like to go."
We leave her house and walk to the park.
It is not far. The weather is nice
today. The sky is blue and the sun is
shining. There are many people in the
park. Some are sitting on benches, some
are walking, and some are playing
sports. We find a bench and sit down. We
continue talking. We speak in English.
Sometimes we stop to look for new words.
Maria says, "I want to learn more words.
I don't know many words yet. I agree.
Yes, I also need to learn more words. I
say we both want to improve our English.
We talk about how we study. Maria says I
listen to music in English and watch
movies. It helps me a lot. I tell her I
watch English movies, too. I also read
books in English.
We both agree that practicing every day
is the best way to learn. After a while,
we decide to take a walk around the
park. We see many beautiful flowers. The
flowers are colorful.
Maria says, "I love flowers.
They are so pretty."
I agree.
Yes, they are beautiful. I say. We walk
around and enjoy the day. The park is
very peaceful. I feel happy because I am
practicing my English and spending time
with my friend. Later, we walk back to
Maria's house. I feel a little tired,
but very happy. We say goodbye at her
door. Thank you for a nice day, Maria. I
say. She smiles and says, "You are
welcome, Sam. It was nice to spend time
with you." We say goodbye and I walk
back home. On the way home, I think
about my day. I feel good because I
practiced speaking English with Maria.
We talked about many things and I
learned new words. I also learned how to
say things in a different way.
I think that learning English is fun
when I practice with friends. When I get
home, I decide to write in my notebook.
I write about my day with Maria. I write
about the park, the coffee, and the
flowers. I also write down some new
words I learned today. Flowers, park,
coffee, and bench. Writing these words
helps me remember them. After writing, I
watch a short video in English. I try to
understand the story. It is not easy,
but I can understand some of it. I feel
proud because I understand more and more
each day. I repeat the words I hear in
the video. I practice speaking.
Before bed, I feel happy. Today was a
good day. I spent time with a friend,
practiced my English, and learned new
things. I know that every day is
important. I will continue to practice.
I will speak English every day, listen
to English, and read English. Little by
little, I will get better. Tomorrow, I
will study more. I will speak with more
people. I will continue my journey to
learn English. I know it will take time,
but I will keep going. Every day I am
getting closer to my goal.
Tomorrow will be even better.
Chapter 5.
It is a quiet morning. I wake up early
just like every day. I feel excited
because today I am going to visit a new
place. My teacher told us about it in
class. She said it is a beautiful garden
where we can practice English. I like
gardens and I want to learn more
English. I get out of bed and go to the
kitchen. I make a simple breakfast. I
have some bread with butter and a cup of
tea. I like tea in the morning. After I
eat, I get dressed in my comfortable
clothes.
I take my bag and I am ready to go. I
leave my house and walk to the bus stop.
I am a little nervous because I don't
know exactly where the garden is, but I
am excited to see it.
The bus comes and I get on. I find a
seat by the window. The bus moves
through the city. I look out the window
and see many people walking on the
street.
Some are in a hurry and some are slow. I
see a man with a dog. The dog is very
cute.
I smile. The bus ride is long, but I
don't mind. I'm happy to have some quiet
time to think.
The bus stops at my stop and I get off.
I follow the directions my teacher gave
us. I walk for about 10 minutes. I see
many shops and buildings.
Then I find the entrance to the garden.
It is a big gate with flowers on both
sides. The flowers are colorful and they
smell nice. I go inside the garden. It
is very beautiful.
There are trees, flowers, and many
benches. The air smells fresh and I hear
birds singing.
It is a peaceful place.
I feel calm and happy. I see my
classmates already sitting on a bench.
They wave at me. I wave back and sit
with them. My teacher is there too. She
smiles and says, "Hello, Sam.
I am glad you are here. Today we will
practice English by talking about
nature."
I smile and say I am happy to be here
teacher.
She says great.
Now let's start. What do you see around
you?
We all look around. There are many
flowers in the garden. Some are yellow,
some are pink, and some are red.
I see many flowers, I say.
My teacher nods and says, "Yes, flowers
are beautiful. What else do you see?" "I
see trees," says my friend Mark. "There
are tall trees and short trees." "Yes,"
my teacher says. "Trees are important.
They give us oxygen and make the air
clean." We talk about trees and flowers
for a while.
Then my teacher asks, "What animals do
you see here?" We all look around. "I
see a bird in the tree," says Maria. "I
see a squirrel," says Ahmed. The
squirrel is running on the ground.
"Yes," my teacher says. Squirrels are
small animals. They like to play in the
trees.
After talking for some time, my teacher
says, "Now, let's practice speaking with
a partner. You can walk around the
garden and talk to each other in
English. Ask each other questions about
the garden. Use new words you have
learned today." I walk with Maria. We
talk about the things we see. I ask her,
"What is your favorite flower?" She
smiles and says, "My favorite flower is
the rose. I like the color and the
smell." I agree. Yes, roses are
beautiful, I say. Maria asks me, "What
animal do you like?" I think for a
moment and answer, "I like birds. They
are free and they can fly." Maria nods.
Yes, I like birds, too. They are nice to
watch.
We continue walking and talking. We
practice our English and I feel happy
because I understand more and more.
After walking for a while, we sit on a
bench to rest. I feel tired, but I am
glad that I practiced English. It is
easier now to speak with my friends. I
can say more things than before. I am
proud of myself. We take a break and
have some water. My teacher comes to sit
with us. She says, "You are doing a
great job. Keep practicing and you will
speak English very well." I smile and
say, "Thank you, teacher. I will
practice every day.
It is almost time to go." We walk back
to the entrance of the garden. My
teacher says, "Today was a good lesson.
We practiced English and learned about
nature. Tomorrow we will learn more new
words. I feel happy because I learned so
much today. I want to learn more." We
say goodbye to each other. I thank my
teacher and my friends. Then I leave the
garden and walk back to the bus stop.
I feel good about my day. I think about
all the new words I learned today, like
squirrel, tree, bird, and flower. I want
to remember these words.
I get on the bus and sit by the window
again. The ride home is calm. I look out
the window and think about my English
journey. I know I am improving every
day. It is not always easy, but it is
worth it. I feel proud because I am
learning and using English more and
more. When I get home, I write in my
notebook. I write about my day in the
garden. I write down the new words I
learned. Writing helps me remember.
After that, I watch a short video in
English. I try to understand the story.
I don't understand everything, but I
understand some parts. I repeat the
words I hear.
Before I go to bed, I feel good. Today
was a great day. I practiced speaking,
listening, and learning new words.
Tomorrow will be even better. I know
that every day brings me closer to my
goal. I am excited for tomorrow.
Chapter 6.
Today is a special day. I wake up early
because I have big plans. I am going to
visit the library. My teacher told us
that the library is a great place to
learn English. I want to find books that
can help me improve my English. I feel
excited because I love reading. I make
breakfast. I eat oatmeal with fruit. It
is healthy and it gives me energy for
the day.
After breakfast, I get dressed. I wear a
comfortable shirt and jeans. I take my
bag and leave the house. I walk to the
bus stop. I feel happy because it is a
nice day.
The sun is shining and the sky is clear.
The bus comes and I get on. I sit by the
window again. I like sitting by the
window because I can see the city as the
bus moves. I watch people walking on the
street. Some people are in a hurry and
some are taking their time. The bus ride
is about 20 minutes. I get off at my
stop and walk to the library.
The library is a big building. It has
many windows and there is a large sign
in front that says public library.
I feel excited because I have heard that
the library has many books in English. I
walk inside and see a large room with
many bookshelves. There are so many
books. I can see books about history,
art, music, and many other subjects. I
feel like I am in a treasure chest of
knowledge. I go to the desk and ask the
librarian, "Hello, can you help me find
books for learning English?" The
librarian smiles and says, "Of course,
follow me." She takes me to a section
with books for learning English. There
are books for beginners and books for
advanced students.
I look at the books. Some have pictures
and some have simple stories.
I pick up a book with simple stories.
The title is Easy English Stories.
I think it will be good for me. The
librarian says, "This is a good book for
beginners.
It will help you learn new words."
I thank the librarian and take the book.
I walk around the library a little more.
I see many people reading or using the
computers. Some are studying and some
are just relaxing.
The library is quiet, but it feels
peaceful.
I like it. I decide to find a seat and
start reading my new book. I sit at a
table near the window. I open the book
and start reading.
The stories are simple, but they are
interesting.
The first story is about a boy who finds
a lost dog. The dog is very cute and the
boy is happy to find it.
I like the story because it is easy to
understand.
I learn some new words like lost and
find. I write them down in my notebook.
Writing new words helps me remember
them.
After reading for a while, I take a
break. I go to the library cafe and buy
a cup of tea. I sit at a table and
relax. I think about how much I am
learning. I feel proud of myself. I am
improving my English every day. I know
it will take time, but I am patient.
Every day I am getting better. I finish
my tea and go back to my book. I read a
few more stories.
After some time, I feel tired. I decide
it is time to go home. I take my book to
the desk to check it out. The librarian
says, "I hope you enjoy your book. Come
back anytime."
I thank her and leave the library. The
bus ride home is calm. I look out the
window and think about what I learned
today. I learned many new words in the
library. I am happy because I am
improving my English. I know that
reading is a great way to learn. I want
to read more books in English. When I
get home, I feel tired but satisfied. I
take out my notebook and write down the
new words I learned today. Lost, find,
and happy. I write sentences with these
words to practice.
The boy is happy because he finds the
dog.
I practice the sentences out loud.
Speaking helps me learn, too. I watch a
short video in English before bed. I try
to understand everything. It is not
easy, but I understand some parts. I
repeat the words I hear. I feel proud
because I am learning more each day.
Before I go to sleep, I think about my
day. It was a good day.
I went to the library, learned new
words, and practiced reading and
speaking. Tomorrow I will study more. I
will read more books, watch more videos,
and speak more English. Every day I am
getting closer to my goal. I know I can
do it. I feel happy and ready for
tomorrow.
Learning English is a journey and I am
making progress.
I know that little by little I will
speak English better. I am excited to
learn more. Tomorrow will be even better
than today.
Chapter 7. Today is a busy day. I wake
up early and feel excited.
I have a lot of things to do today. I
want to study English. meet my friends
and go to a new place. I start the day
by having breakfast. I eat eggs and
toast with butter. I drink some juice. I
like having breakfast in the morning
because it gives me energy. After
breakfast, I get ready. I put on my
shoes, take my bag, and leave the house.
It is a sunny day and the sky is blue.
I walk to the bus stop.
When I get there, I see my friend Ahmed.
He is waiting for the bus, too. I wave
at him and he smiles.
"Good morning, Sam," he says. "Good
morning, Ahmed," I answer.
The bus comes and we both get on. We sit
together. We talk about our English
lessons and how we are learning. Ahmed
tells me, "I like studying English, but
it is sometimes difficult." I agree with
him. Yes, it is hard, but we can do it.
Every day we get better, I say. Ahmed
smiles.
You are right, Sam. We just need to
practice every day.
We talk more as the bus moves through
the city. I look out the window and see
many people. Some are walking quickly
and some are sitting in the park.
Some people are riding bikes. The bus
stops at my stop and I get off. Ahmed
says, "See you later, Sam." I wave
goodbye to him and continue walking to
my destination. Today I am going to the
market. I want to practice my English by
talking to people at the market. It is a
good place to learn new words. When I
arrive, I see many shops. There are
fruit stands, vegetable stands, and
flower shops.
I take a deep breath. The air smells
fresh, and I see many colors.
I walk to the first shop. It sells
fruit. The shopkeeper smiles at me and
says, "Hello, how can I help you?"
I smile back and answer, "Hello, I want
to buy some apples."
The shopkeeper asks, "How many apples do
you want?"
I think for a moment and say, "I want
six apples, please." The shopkeeper
picks the apples and puts them in a bag.
I pay him and say, "Thank you."
He smiles and says, "You are welcome."
I continue walking around the market. I
see many people buying food and talking.
I go to a vegetable stand. The woman at
the stand says, "Good afternoon. What
can I get for you?" I answer, "I want
some tomatoes and carrots, please." She
puts the tomatoes and carrots in a bag.
I pay her and say thank you. She smiles
and says have a nice day. I feel happy
because I am practicing my English. I am
speaking to different people and
learning new words. After buying the
vegetables, I decide to buy some
flowers. I go to a flower shop and ask
the woman, "How much are the flowers?"
She says, "The flowers are 3 each." I
look at the flowers and pick some red
roses.
I will take these, please, I say. The
woman gives me the roses and I pay her.
Thank you, I say, and she answers. You
are welcome. Have a good day.
After shopping, I sit on a bench in the
market. I feel proud because I used
English to talk to different people. I
am getting better every day. Speaking
with others helps me learn faster.
I think about how far I have come. When
I first started learning English, I was
scared to speak.
But now it is easier and I am more
confident.
I take a break and drink some water.
I look at the things I bought. The
apples, tomatoes, carrots, and flowers.
It feels good to have fresh food.
After a while, I decide it is time to go
home.
I walk to the bus stop and wait for the
bus. On the bus, I think about my day. I
feel happy because I practiced speaking
English. I feel proud because I talked
to people at the market. I also learned
new words like apples, tomatoes,
carrots, and roses. Every day I learn
more. I am not afraid to speak English
anymore. I know that the more I speak,
the better I get. When I get home, I put
my shopping on the kitchen table. I take
out my notebook and write down the new
words I learned today. I write apples,
tomatoes, carrots, and roses. I make
sentences with these words. I bought
apples at the market. I like to eat
tomatoes. Carrots are good for you.
Roses are beautiful flowers.
After writing, I watch a short video in
English.
I listen carefully and try to understand
the story. I don't understand everything
but I understand some parts. I repeat
the words I hear. I feel good because I
am practicing.
I know that every time I practice I get
better.
Before bed I think about what I did
today. It was a great day. I practiced
English at the market, learned new
words, and felt more confident. I know
that tomorrow will be another good day.
I will continue to study, speak, and
learn.
Every day I am getting closer to my goal
of speaking English fluently.
I am proud of myself. I know that
learning English takes time, but I am
working hard. Little by little, I will
reach my goal. Tomorrow, I will practice
more. I look forward to the new day and
new opportunities to learn.
